page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY OF FORDYCE
page.content:
RECENT EVENTS
In 1976, European Architectural Heritage year, Fordyce village, having earlier been made a conservation area, benefitted from Scottish Development Dept. grants to preserve and improve the village.There were 37 buildings listed as having architectural and historic inportance, owners being offered financial help to bring these up to standard.Overhead power cables were repositioned underground,new street lighting supplied,footpaths re- surfaced, street names & traffic signs replaced,damaged buildings restored, trees planted & amenity areas for adults & children provided.Other im- provements must now conform strictly to conservation guidelines.Development of the village is therefore monitored.
